document_title: Erectile dysfunction in women: Causes, symptoms and ways to improve
subsection_name: yeu-sinh-ly-o-nu.json_2_Is erectile dysfunction in women the same as in men?
subsection_content:
A study in the UK showed that women are twice as likely as men to have decreased sexual desire in a long-term relationship. When asked about their sex life, about 15% of men and 34% of women participating in the survey revealed that they were no longer interested in sex when the relationship lasted 3 months or more than 1 year. Reduced sexual desire is most common in men aged 35-44, in women it is 55-64 years old.
In men, erectile dysfunction can be easily recognized through symptoms such as premature ejaculation, erectile dysfunction, orgasm disorder... However, erectile dysfunction in women has no obvious symptoms. , so it is very difficult to recognize and make adjustments in love.
subsection_title: yeu sinh ly o nu.json. Is erectile dysfunction in women the same as in men?
